block.p: ''FORT FRINGE JR.,'' free outdoor events from the New York International Fringe Festival suitable for children, features a ''World Family Picnic,'' with face painting, entertainment and food, tomorrow and next Saturday, noon to 2 p.m. at La Plaza Garden, Ninth Street and Avenue C, East Village. On Sunday and Aug. 25, 1 to 3 p.m., activities will be found on Orchard Street, at Rivington Street, the Lower East Side. Information: (212) 420-8877; www.fringenyc.org.

''FORT FRINGE JR.,'' free outdoor events from the New York International Fringe Festival suitable for children, features a ''World Family Picnic,'' with face painting, entertainment and food, tomorrow and next Saturday, noon to 2 p.m. at La Plaza Garden, Ninth Street and Avenue C, East Village. On Sunday and Aug. 25, 1 to 3 p.m., activities will be found on Orchard Street, at Rivington Street, the Lower East Side. Information: (212) 420-8877; www.fringenyc.org.

THIRD MOMA FAMILY PICNIC, with entertainment, an arts workshop and a barbecue dinner, tomorrow, 5:30 to 7:30 p.m., at the Museum of Modern Art in Queens, 33rd Street and Queens Boulevard, Long Island City. Youngsters should bring along a photograph from a family vacation to use in the workshop. Fee, $10. Registration advised, (212) 708-9848.

''BARNEY THE DINOSAUR, BJ AND BABY BOP,'' stars of the television show ''Barney and Friends,'' will give a free concert tomorrow at 11 a.m. in Battery Park, Lower Manhattan, the first of several appearances around the country to mark the show's new season next month on PBS. Information: (800) 862-2763 or www.barney.com.

BRONX INTERNATIONAL CHAMPIONSHIP RODEO will take to the baseball fields at Crotona Park, 3 Crotona Avenue, the Bronx. The event includes a tribute to firefighters and rescue workers killed on Sept. 11. Shows today at 1 p.m., tomorrow at 4 p.m. and Sunday at 5 p.m. Tickets, $6 in advance, $8 on the day; proceeds benefit the Sports and Arts in Schools Foundation. Information: (718) 786-7110, Ext. 167.

''TERRIBLY TERRIFIC TWOS'' celebrates the 2-year-olds in residence at the Bronx Zoo with a weekend of storytelling, face painting, crafts workshops and a special appearance by members of the New York Mets (tomorrow only). Tomorrow and Sunday, 11:30 to 4:30 p.m. The zoo is at the Bronx River Parkway and Fordham Road. Admission fees and other information: (718) 367-1010.

''CHILD VIRTUOSOS: A MUSICAL ENCOUNTER,'' will let youngsters hear performances by young musicians and then speak with them afterward, tomorrow at 8 p.m. at Snug Harbor, Veterans Memorial Hall, 1000 Richmond Terrace, Livingston, Staten Island. Tickets, $15, $10 for students and children. Information: (718) 815-7684.

''THE PRINCE AND THE PAUPER,'' a musical adaptation of the Mark Twain novel, at the Lamb's Theater, 130 West 44th Street, Manhattan. Mondays and Fridays at 8 p.m.; Tuesdays at 7 p.m.; Wednesdays and Saturdays at 2:30 and 8 p.m.; Sundays at 3 p.m. Tickets: $40 and $55. Information: (212) 239-6200.

''LITTLE RED: GIRL FROM THE HOOD,'' an urban take on the classic children's story ''Little Red Riding Hood,'' presented outdoors tomorrow at 3 p.m. at the Queens Museum of Art, Flushing Meadows-Corona Park. Free, but spectators should bring their own seating; the museum will also be open for visiting at no charge after the show. Information: (718) 592-9700, Ext. 222.

''THUMBELINA,'' a production presented by the Papageno Puppet Theater with music by Ravel. Today through Sunday at 11:30 a.m. and 2 p.m., 462 Columbus Avenue, at 82nd Street, Manhattan. Admission: $7. Reservations recommended: (212) 874-3297.

''THE SECRETS OF SURVIVAL,'' a show that combines mime, gymnastics and music, Sundays and Mondays at 8 p.m. through Aug. 26 at the SoHo Playhouse, 15 Vandam Street. Tickets, $30; $20 for children and students. Information: (212) 239-6200.

''ROBOTICS,'' a science display, continues this weekend with storytelling, workshops and performances at the New York Hall of Science, 47-01 111th Street, Flushing Meadows-Corona Park, Queens. Tomorrow and Sunday, 12:30 to 4 p.m. Admission, $7.50, $5 for those 5 to 17. Information: (718) 699-0005.
